thread.title: Mexican singer to be sent to South Carolina for assault case
thread.title_full: Mexican singer to be sent to South Carolina for assault case

title: Mexican singer to be sent to South Carolina for assault case
text:
Mexican singer to be sent to South Carolina for assault case 4:20 p.m. Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015 | Filed in: Celebrity news Comments 0 ï»¿ 
A California judge says regional Mexican music singer and television star Larry Hernandez will be extradited to South Carolina where he's accused of kidnapping and assault stemming from a business dispute. 
The 38-year-old singer agreed to extradition during a court hearing Wednesday in San Bernardino. Hernandez will remain jailed without bail until authorities transport him to South Carolina. FILE - This Aug. 6, 2014 photo shows Mexican singer Larry Hernandez posing for a photo during an interview in Los Angeles. Hernandez who stars in a Spanish-language TV show was arrested at Ontario Airport on a warrant out of South Carolina, authorities said Monday, Sept. 28. Hernandez, 38, was taken into custody on suspicion of kidnapping, assault and assault and battery causing injury. (AP Photo/Richard Vogel, File) 
His lawyers declined to comment. 
Hernandez stars in the Spanish-language show "Larrymania." He was arrested Friday at Ontario International Airport on a fugitive warrant issued in South Carolina. 
Police in Newberry, South Carolina, say Hernandez is wanted on kidnapping and assault charges filed after a businessman accused the singer of punching him and pushing him into a wall during a dispute over payment for a concert last month.
